meanings.definition: A substance used to cover mistakes in writing.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally made a mistake on my paper, so I used whiteout to fix it.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps whiteout in her pencil case to correct errors in her notes.
meanings.sent3: The whiteout saved me from having to rewrite the entire page.
meanings.sent4: Using whiteout is like giving your writing a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The whiteout made the error disappear as if it was never there.

meanings.definition: A weather condition in which visibility is greatly reduced due to falling or blowing snow.
meanings.sent1: The blizzard caused a whiteout, making it impossible to see more than a few feet ahead.
meanings.sent2: Drivers were warned to stay off the roads during the whiteout to avoid accidents.
meanings.sent3: The sudden whiteout turned the peaceful snowfall into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent4: The whiteout blanketed the landscape in a thick veil of snow.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the whiteout felt like being lost in a sea of white.
